title: Orange-Miso Glazed Black Cod with Sesame Rice

instructions: Add miso, orange juice, mirin, soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger to a bowl.
Whisk until fully combined and smooth.
Set aside half of the glaze for basting later.
tips: Use room-temperature miso to make mixing easier.
Freshly squeezed orange juice gives a cleaner flavor.

instructions: Pat fish dry with paper towels.
Place fillets into a shallow dish.
Pour half of the glaze over the fish.
Turn gently to coat evenly.
tips: Avoid over-mixing to prevent damaging delicate fish.

instructions: Cover the dish and place it in the refrigerator.
Allow the fish to marinate to absorb flavors.
tips: Do not exceed 60 min or miso may make the fish too salty.

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Line a baking sheet with foil.
Lightly oil the foil to prevent sticking.
tips: Use parchment under foil if you want an easier cleanup.

instructions: Place fillets skin-side down on the tray.
Roast for 8–10 minutes until flaky and opaque.
Baste once or twice using remaining glaze.
tips: Do not overcook — sablefish becomes dry quickly.

instructions: Fluff warm rice with a fork.
Add sesame oil, sesame seeds, and a pinch of salt.
Mix gently to keep grains intact.
tips: Short-grain rice retains moisture and pairs best with miso flavors.

instructions: Spoon rice into serving bowls.
Place glazed cod on top.
Finish with sliced scallions and citrus zest.
tips: Zest adds balance by cutting through savory sweetness.
